175.title: NEET-UG 2022 results declared; Rajasthan's Tanishka emerges topper
175.article_body: National Testing Agency has announced the medical entrance exam NEET-UG 2022 results. While 17,64,571 candidates appeared, 9,93,069 have passed. Maximum qualifying candidates are from Uttar Pradesh, followed by Maharashtra. Rajasthan's Tanishka has emerged as the topper of the entrance test, despite four candidates scoring equal marks. Vatsa Ashish Batra from Delhi has secured the second position.

176.title: Mumbai diagnostic lab staffer cheated of ₹49,500 via Google Pay
176.article_body: A 27-year-old woman working at a diagnostic centre in Mumbai was cheated of ₹49,500 by a man who said he wanted to get blood tests done for 25 people. The victim was instructed over a video call to open her Google Pay app and select the "Pay bills" option. A case has been registered by Mumbai Police.

177.title: Leopard spotted on campus of defence institute in Pune
177.article_body: A leopard was sighted on the campus of Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DIAT) in Pune on Tuesday night. According to DIAT officials, security personnel saw the leopard on a tree after they were alerted by the barking of dogs. "Security guards also recorded a video of the leopard getting down from the tree," said an officer.

178.title: IMD issues yellow alert for Pune till September 11
178.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a 'yellow' alert for the Pune district till September 11, warning of heavy rain, thunder, lightning and gusty winds. Notably, Pune's Shivajinagar recorded 42.8 mm of rainfall from 8.30 am to 11.30 pm on Wednesday. IMD has also issued a 'yellow' alert for Palghar, Thane, Mumbai, Nashik and other districts till Sunday.

179.title: Pharma company GSK fires employee after viral video of his abusive rant on flight
179.article_body: Pharmaceutical and biotech company GlaxoSmithKline fired one of its employees after he was caught on camera yelling homophobic and racist slurs on a Philadelphia-Dallas flight. The chemical engineer was seen shouting profanities at fellow passengers while being removed from the flight. Before getting off the plane, he also declared that he is a chemical engineer who works for GlaxoSmithKline.

180.title: 30-yr-old wanted for stabbing 10 people to death in Canada dies soon after arrest
180.article_body: The suspect sought by Canadian authorities in a stabbing incident that killed 10 people was arrested on Wednesday but suffered unspecified "medical distress" and died a short time later at a hospital. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police added that Myles Sanderson, 30, was arrested near the town of Rosthern, Saskatchewan. Earlier, Myles' brother, also a suspect, was found dead.

181.title: BESCOM blames ad firm for woman's electrocution in Bengaluru
181.article_body: Two days after a 22-year-old woman died of electrocution on a waterlogged road, Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) told the police that it was not responsible for the incident. "They have put the blame on an advertisement agency saying it was the wiring from the billboard attached to the electric post that led to the electrocution," the police said.

182.title: Harbhajan Singh helps in rescuing 21-year-old Punjab girl held captive in Oman
182.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Harbhajan Singh helped in rescuing 21-year-old Punjab girl named Kamaljeet Kaur, who was "illegally held" in Oman. The ex-cricketer collaborated with Indian Embassy in Oman for her rescue. Kamaljeet had approached a local agent in Punjab, who promised her job of cook for an Indian family in Oman. However, when she reached Oman, she was held captive.

183.title: Rahul Gandhi to sleep in container for 150 days of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
183.article_body: During the 150-day 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress' Rahul Gandhi will stay and sleep in a container. As per ANI, Congress has denied that Rahul will put up in hotels during the nationwide 'yatra'. Instead, containers have been prepared to accommodate the Congress MP and other party leaders who will accompany him on the yatra.

184.title: 3 men trimming tree electrocuted as iron trolley touches wire in Delhi
184.article_body: At least three men were electrocuted after an iron trolley that they were using to trim leaves of trees at a farmhouse, used for hosting wedding functions, in Delhi's Bawana came in contact with a live wire, police said. While two of the victims were trimming the tree leaves using the trolley, the third victim had come to their rescue.

185.title: Scolded for coming late, Class 10 boy hits school guard with rod in Delhi
185.article_body: A Class 10 student allegedly attacked a guard of his school with an iron rod in Delhi's Tilak Nagar on Wednesday after being scolded for coming late to school. The 32-year-old guard, Vijay Kumar, sustained minor injury and was hospitalised. The 16-year-old boy had got into an argument with Kumar two days ago for coming late to school, police said.

186.title: Apple to release iOS 16 with redesigned lock screen on September 12
186.article_body: Apple has announced that it will be releasing its latest operating system iOS 16 on September 12. iOS 16 will allow users to add widgets to the lock screen, use the Live Text feature to pull text from videos and photos and edit and recall messages sent on iMessage. It'll also offer passkeys as an easier and safer sign-in method.

187.title: Pakistan's Asif Ali fights with Afghan bowler, almost hits him with bat; video viral
187.article_body: Pakistan's Asif Ali pushed Afghanistan fast bowler Fareed Ahmad Malik after the latter dismissed him in their Asia Cup 2022 match on Wednesday. A video has gone viral showing Fareed giving Asif a send-off after which Asif pushes him and almost hits him with his bat. Other Afghanistan players and the umpire intervened and separated Asif and Fareed.

188.title: Apple unveils iPhone 14 Pro, iPhone 14 Pro Max starting from $999 & $1,099
188.article_body: Apple unveiled iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max smartphones starting from $999 and $1,099 respectively. The phones come with 6.1-inch and 6.7-inch screens with always-on display and have a new pill-shaped cut-out called the 'Dynamic Island'. The phones also feature a 48MP main camera. They will come in four different colours.

189.title: Apple unveils iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus starting from $799 and $899
189.article_body: Apple unveiled the iPhone 14 with a 6.1-inch display and iPhone 14 Plus with a 6.7-inch display starting from $799 and $899, respectively. They come with a familiar notch at the top and a new 12MP main camera and new front camera with auto-focus. The iPhone 14 also has new sensors that can detect a car crash.

190.title: Apple unveils 2nd generation AirPods Pro with 6-hour listening time costing $249
190.article_body: Apple on Wednesday unveiled the second generation AirPods Pro costing $249, marking the first update for the Pro model since the initial launch in 2019. The new AirPods Pro can cancel twice as much noise and allow six hours of listening on a single charge. It comes with swipe controls on the stems and a speaker in its charging case.

191.title: Apple unveils second-generation Apple Watch SE starting from $249
191.article_body: Apple has unveiled the second-generation Apple Watch SE model starting from $249. The Apple Watch SE, with a 30% larger display than the Series 3, will have fall detection, crash detection, family setup and activity tracking along with Emergency SOS. It'll feature the S8 chip and will cost $249 for the GPS model and $299 for the cellular model.

192.title: Apple unveils Apple Watch Ultra for extreme sports costing $799
192.article_body: Apple has unveiled Apple Watch Ultra with a 49 mm titanium case and a customisable action button, which will cost $799. It has been specifically designed for intense sports tracking. The Apple Watch Ultra is WR-100 water resistant and it has an automatic built-in depth gauge. It's also EN13319 certified, which means it can be used as a dive computer.

193.title: At least $1 billion required to avert famine in Somalia: UN
193.article_body: At least $1 billion is urgently needed to avert a famine in Somalia, the United Nations (UN) said. The warning comes as two more dry seasons are predicted for the country. UN official Martin Griffiths said this new funding requirement is separate from the UN's recent appeal of about $1.4 billion in emergency aid to the country.

194.title: Pandemic increased waitlist by 3-fold at AIIMS' corneal transplant centre: Chief doctor
194.article_body: The number of patients waiting for corneal transplant at Dr RP Centre for Ophthalmic Sciences, AIIMS, has increased by three-fold due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the centre's chief Dr JS Titiyal said. The National Eye Bank at the institute saw 88 per cent utilisation rate of corneas in 2021, which was higher than the national average of 67 per cent.

195.title: Govt to tighten rules over fake, paid reviews on social media
195.article_body: The Indian government has decided to tighten rules regarding fake and/or paid reviews on e-commerce websites and social media. Rohit Kumar Singh from India's consumer affairs department said that the government will soon announce a framework of regulations targeting people who are paid for endorsements. He added that those endorsing will be held liable in issues related to the product.

196.title: Nearly 380 killed in tribal clashes in Sudan this year: UN
196.article_body: The United Nations (UN) has said nearly 380 people have been killed in tribal clashes in Sudan from January to August this year. Over 430 people were injured in the same period, which saw 224 violent incidents in 12 of the 18 provinces of the country. Most of the violence was reported from conflict-hit Darfur region.

197.title: 2 die after car runs over labourers sleeping on footpath in UP
197.article_body: Two labourers died and one was injured after a speeding SUV ran over labourers who were asleep on a footpath in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur, the police said. All four people travelling in the car were arrested by the police. They added that the SUV lost control and hit the railing of the Gorakhnath overbridge, before running over the sleeping labourers.

198.title: India crash out of Asia Cup 2022 final race as Pakistan defeat Afghanistan in last over
198.article_body: India have crashed out of the Asia Cup 2022 final race after Pakistan defeated Afghanistan in the last over in their Super 4 stage match on Wednesday. Afghanistan are also officially out of the final race. The final will now be played between Pakistan and Sri Lanka on Sunday. India and Afghanistan will face each other in dead-rubber encounter tomorrow.

199.title: Apple unveils Watch Series 8 with car crash detection starting from $399
199.article_body: Apple has unveiled the Apple Watch Series 8 starting from $399. The new model is capable of detecting a car crash and notifying emergency services and emergency contacts. The Series 8 features an always-on display with narrow edges, and is crack-resistant and swim-proof. The Watch Series 8 comes with temperature sensors and new cycle tracking feature to help track ovulation.

200.title: SC's Justice Chandrachud-led Constitution bench to go paperless
200.article_body: The Supreme Court's Constitution bench has decided to go completely paperless while hearing the Centre and the Delhi government dispute over administrative control. The five-judge bench led by Justice DY Chandrachud also said that the Information Technology cell of the court agreed to train seniors on the use of technology. The court has also allowed the proceedings to be recorded.

201.title: Some chimpanzees are rock drummers, some jazz: Study
201.article_body: A new study has found that chimpanzees use their feet and hands to drum out messages to one another on tree roots. Moreover, they also have their signature styles of drumming that resemble rock or jazz rhythms. The study revealed this skill helps them to spread information over long distances, indicating their location and what they are doing.

202.title: NIA announces ₹10 lakh bounty on fugitive terrorist Harpreet Singh
202.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Wednesday announced a cash reward of ₹10 lakh for any information leading to the arrest of fugitive terrorist Harpreet Singh alias 'Happy Malaysia', who is accused in the 2021 Ludhiana court complex blast. He's currently is Malaysia, the NIA said. It added that he's associated with International Sikh Youth Federation, which planned the blast.

203.title: 21L farmers found ineligible for farm support scheme: UP Minister
203.article_body: Of the 2.85 crore farmers selected under the Centre's Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi scheme in Uttar Pradesh, 21 lakh have been found ineligible, said state Agriculture Minister Surya Pratap Shahi on Wednesday. The money transferred to the ineligible beneficiaries will be recovered, Shahi said. Under the scheme, ₹6,000 income support is given to all land-holding farmer families annually.

204.title: Govt extends ceasefire agreement with Naga insurgent group for a year
204.article_body: The central government has extended the ceasefire agreement with National Socialist Council of Nagaland (K) Niki group, a break-away faction of the Nagaland insurgent group NSCN, by another year. The decision was announced by the Union Home Ministry on Wednesday. NSCN (K) Niki is led by Niki Sumi, who is accused of killing 18 Indian soldiers in Manipur in 2015.

205.title: Lucknow's Levana Suites sealed after fire killed 4 people
205.article_body: The Lucknow Development Authority on Wednesday sealed the Levana Suites hotel where a fire accident killed four people on Monday. The authority is said to have found several building norm violations and has recommended action against responsible persons. The police on Tuesday had arrested hotel owners Rahul and Rohit Agarwal and General Manager Sagar Srivastava.

206.title: US, India will work for free and open Indo-Pacific: White House
206.article_body: The US will partner with India to advance a free and open Indo-Pacific, the White House has said. Press Secretary Karin Jean-Pierre said India and the US are partners in important areas, including climate, defence, vaccines and technology. The comments come as China is engaged in several territorial disputes in the South China Sea (SCS) and the East China Sea.

207.title: No such thing: Alia on unfavourable environment for Bollywood
207.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she doesn't think there is a negative environment against Bollywood. "There is no such thing. It is a beautiful environment to release a movie. Right now, we need to be healthy, happy, safe and secure. We should all feel grateful for just life in general," she said at a press conference. Alia concluded, "Everything is positive."

208.title: Won't be part of TKSS, wanted to take break: Chandan
208.article_body: Chandan Prabhakar of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS) has confirmed that he is not returning to the show's new season. Chandan clarified that there is no specific reason for not coming back and he "just wanted to take a break". Earlier, Krushna Abhishek had shared that he won't be a part of Kapil Sharma's show because of "agreement issues".

209.title: Medha Patkar is urban naxal, AAP projecting her as Guj CM face: Paatil
209.article_body: BJP leader CR Paatil on Wednesday termed Narmada Bachao Andolan activist Medha Patkar an "urban naxal" and "staunch anti-Gujarat person", claiming that AAP is projecting her as a CM candidate in upcoming state Assembly elections. AAP, however, has refuted Paatil's claim. Notably, Patkar had contested the 2014 Lok Sabha polls from Mumbai North East as an AAP candidate.

210.title: Count this as 1156th day of the reign of Babar: Rizwan after becoming no. 1 T20I batter
210.article_body: After displacing his compatriot Babar Azam as the world number one T20I batter, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan tweeted, "Count this as 1156th day of the reign of Kaptaan @babarazam258." He added, "Kaptaan or me alag nahi hain...King remains the King. Hum sab aik hain." Babar has been at top of the T20I batting rankings for 1,155 days in his career.

211.title: Nick Kyrgios smashes and breaks 2 racquets after crashing out of US Open, video viral
211.article_body: World number 25 Nick Kyrgios smashed and broke two racquets after crashing out of the US Open 2022 in the quarter-finals. Kyrgios lost the quarter-final to Russia's Karen Khachanov 5-7, 6-4, 5-7, 7-6(7-3), 4-6. Kyrgios was also seen throwing a drinks bottle on the court during the match. After the match, Kyrgios stated that he was "devastated".

212.title: Felt bad that Ranbir-Alia couldn't visit Mahakaleshwar temple: Ayan
212.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji said he "felt very bad" that Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt couldn't seek blessings at Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga temple, Ujjain. Ayan said the couple was "very keen" to visit. However, when they heard of the protest against Ranbir for his past comments on eating beef, Ayan said he decided he should go alone and seek blessings for everybody.

213.title: India's health sector to become $50 bn industry by 2025: Minister
213.article_body: Union Minister of State for Science and Technology Dr Jitendra Singh on Wednesday said that India's healthcare sector is expected to grow to reach the size of $50 billion by the year 2025. About 80% of the healthcare system aims to increase investment in digital healthcare tools in the coming five years, he said.

214.title: BJP, RSS think Tricolour is their personal property: Rahul Gandhi
214.article_body: While addressing the public during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' campaign in Kanniyakumari on Wednesday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the Indian national flag is under attack by the BJP and the RSS. "They think that this flag is their personal property," he added. He stated that the flag was not earned by one person but by every single Indian.

215.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is India's second freedom struggle: Chidambaram
215.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is the country's second freedom struggle and it'll go on till divisive forces are defeated. "I wish to tell those criticising...'Bharat Jodo Yatra' that you had no role in India's freedom struggle during which Mahatma Gandhi gave the slogan: do or die," Chidambaram said. "Now too, you'll have no role," he added.

216.title: JNU students claim admin imposing fines up to ₹15,000 over protests
216.article_body: Accusing the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) administration of "harassment", a section of students have claimed that fines of up to ₹15,000 are being imposed on them for participating in protests. The students also said that they have been "banned" from registering for the next semester. The JNU Chief Proctor, Rajnish Kumar Mishra, has, however, denied these allegations.

217.title: SC allows Alt News Co-founder to move Delhi HC against FIR in UP
217.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair to approach the Delhi High Court for quashing an FIR against him in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur. The FIR was lodged by the Rashtriya Hindu Sher Sena's Sitapur district head Bhagwan Sharan. He alleged that a tweet by Zubair hurt his religious sentiments.

218.title: 'Chup' looks at how adverse reviews impact films: R Balki
218.article_body: Director R Balki said he got the idea of 'Chup' after his film 'Cheeni Kum' failed to impress the critics. "My film looks at how adverse reviews impact a film," he said. Balki said he likes to surprise himself and his audience by doing "something completely unexpected".  'Chup' stars Sunny Deol, Dulquer Salmaan and Shreya Dhanwanthary in the lead roles.

219.title: Leader can be decided later: Nitish on Oppn alliance after meeting Pawar
219.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met Nationalist Congress Party supremo Sharad Pawar on Wednesday to discuss the formation of an opposition alliance to take on the BJP in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "The alliance's [leader] can be decided later. It's important to come together first," Kumar said. Notably, Kumar recently refuted speculations about desiring to become the next PM.

220.title: Brad Pitt sued by Angelina Jolie's former company for $250 mn over French winery dispute
220.article_body: A company founded by Angelina Jolie filed a case against Brad Pitt for $250 million. It's over the couple's French winery that they bought together. In July, a judge said Brad and his partners must turn over documents to Angelina's team, making her win the case. The new lawsuit claims Brad launched campaign to "seize control" of the winery.

221.title: NASA to repair leak at Artemis-1 moon rocket on launch pad itself
221.article_body: NASA will replace the faulty seal that caused a hydrogen leak in a "quick disconnect" interface between the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and the liquid hydrogen fuel feed line at the launch pad itself. The launch vehicle will then be moved back into the Vehicle Assembly Building (VAB). NASA's Artemis 1 Moon mission was postponed due to hydrogen leak.

222.title: Ease of doing business in India appeals to Adobe: CEO Narayen
222.article_body: The ease of doing business in India and digitisation appeal to Adobe, the company's CEO Shantanu Narayen said. "We have been expanding dramatically in India," Narayen said. "[To] hear about the ambitious idea of how the GDP gonna evolve, how the PLI schemes and what's happening with commerce and what's happening with transactions, it's inspiring," he added.

223.title: UK PM Liz Truss' Cabinet is Britain's first without white man in 4 most senior posts
223.article_body: UK PM Liz Truss' Cabinet marks the first time a white man doesn't hold any of the country's four most important ministerial positions. Truss appointed Kwasi Kwarteng as Britain's first Black finance minister, while James Cleverly is the country's first Black foreign minister. Meanwhile, Suella Braverman has been appointed interior minister and Therese Coffey has been appointed health minister.

224.title: Immense scope to cooperate with Russia in field of energy: PM Modi
224.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said on Wednesday that India is keen to strengthen its partnership with Russia on Arctic subjects. He added that there is immense potential for both countries to cooperate in the field of energy. PM Modi's remarks came during an online plenary session address at the Eastern Economic Forum, which is being held in Russia's Vladivostok.

225.title: $258-bn lawsuit accusing Musk of driving Dogecoin's prices up expands
225.article_body: The $258-billion racketeering lawsuit accusing billionaire Elon Musk of intentionally driving up prices of Dogecoin over 36,000% over two years and then letting it crash has expanded. The lawsuit has now added seven investor plaintiffs and six defendants. According to an amended complaint filed on Tuesday, Musk's Tesla, SpaceX and Boring Co, among others were part of the racketeering attempt.

226.title: K'taka BJP's 'Janotsava' rally postponed due to demise of Umesh Katti
226.article_body: Karnataka BJP's 'Janotsava' rally, scheduled to be held at Doddaballapura on Thursday, has been postponed to September 11 due to the demise of minister Umesh Katti. This is the third such postponement of the event. The event is set to mark the completion of three years of BJP's rule in Karnataka and the Basavaraj Bommai-led government's one year in office.

227.title: Orange Health announces ESOP, equity buyback worth $1 mn
227.article_body: Accel-backed diagnostic firm Orange Health has announced its maiden Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP) and equity buyback programme worth $1 million. 25 existing and former employees are eligible to participate in the ESOP buyback and liquidate their stock options, the company said in a statement. The Bengaluru-based startup was founded in 2020 by Dhruv Gupta and Tarun Bhambra.

228.title: 2 elderly farmers electrocuted to death in MP's Gwalior
228.article_body: Two elderly farmers were electrocuted after they accidentally came in contact with a power transformer while working in their agricultural field in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior on Wednesday, police said. The deceased were identified as 60-year-old Chandan Singh Kushwaha and 65-year-old Mayaram Patsaria. People working nearby took them to a hospital, where they were declared dead, police added.

229.title: Putin, Xi to meet in Uzbekistan next week
229.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping are set to meet in Uzbekistan next week, an official said on Wednesday. The meeting will take place at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Samarkand, said Russian Ambassador to China Andrei Denisov. Xi and Putin last met in Beijing in February, few weeks before Moscow ordered the invasion of Ukraine.

230.title: US oil price falls below $85 mark for first time since Jan over demand fears
230.article_body: US oil price fell below the $85 mark for the first time since January 2022 as a dollar surge and global demand concerns pulled down prices despite Russia's threat to disrupt supplies. As of 8:30 pm, US West Texas Intermediate had fallen $3.21 to $83.67/barrel while Brent crude had fallen $3.08 to $89.75/barrel. Both indices had fallen over 3.5%.

231.title: Fisherman suffers gunshot injury near Navy's gunnery school in Kerala
231.article_body: A 60-year-old fisherman suffered a gunshot injury in the ear when he was coming to shore on his boat near INS Dronacharya, a gunnery school of the Indian Navy, in Kerala's Kochi. The Navy said the bullet was not manufactured by it. As per a police official, the injury was minor and the bullet was found inside the boat.

232.title: Will introduce framework to regulate social media: Govt tells HC
232.article_body: The Centre told the Delhi High Court that it will introduce a framework to regulate social media platforms at "some point in time". Since the framework will be prospective, the Centre said that suspension of social media accounts will be looked at under the existing regulations. The HC granted the Centre further time to apprise it of new developments.

233.title: Man arrested from Rajasthan for giving death threat to Sidhu Moosewala's father
233.article_body: A man has been arrested from Rajasthan's Jodhpur for allegedly sending a death threat to late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh Sidhu. In a police complaint, Balkaur Singh stated that he got a mail wherein a threat was made to his life and money was demanded from him. Punjab Police has got a five-day custody of the accused.

234.title: Govt asks Amazon to stop selling devices that can disable car seat belt alarms
234.article_body: Government has asked Amazon to stop selling devices designed to disable car seat belt alarms, Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said. Gadkari stated metal clips are inserted in seat belt slots to bypass alarm that keeps pinging when belts aren't in use while a car is being driven. This comes after the recent demise of Cyrus Mistry in a car crash.

235.title: Can put PM's pic on gas cylinders: MLC amid Modi pic row in Telangana
235.article_body: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman questioned the absence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's picture from a ration shop in Telangana, MLC K Kavitha said that past Prime Ministers' pictures weren't displayed outside ration shops. "If you want [PM's] pictures to be put up, we'll...do so [wherever the costs are rising]...We'll put them up on gas cylinders…[and at] petrol...stations," she added.

236.title: Bank of Maharashtra raises ₹710 cr from bonds for business growth
236.article_body: State-owned Bank of Maharashtra (BoM) on Wednesday said that it has raised ₹710 crore from bonds to fund business growth. According to BoM, the capital was raised via Basel III compliant Additional Tier 1 bonds of ₹710 crore at a coupon rate of 8.74%. The issue reportedly garnered overwhelming response from investors as the issue was subscribed by 10 times.

237.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' landmark occasion for Congress: Sonia Gandhi
237.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a landmark occasion for the party. Stating that the party would be rejuvenated through this rally, she also expressed regret at her inability to join in person owing to medical checkups and added that she would participate in spirit. Gandhi described the occasion as a "transformational moment in Indian politics".

238.title: Bengaluru hotel room rates jump to ₹40,000 per night amid floods
238.article_body: Hotel room rates in Bengaluru have doubled to ₹30,000-₹40,000 per night amid floods in the city. This comes after several residents, whose houses have been inundated, started moving into the hotels. As per reports, many of the hotels at Old Airport Road, Whitefield, Outer Ring Road and Koramangala are fully booked till Friday.

239.title: Earliest known mammal that lived 225 mn years ago identified by its teeth
239.article_body: Using fossil dental records, scientists have identified the earliest known mammal that lived 225 million years ago. A shrew-like creature, Brasilodon quadrangularis, grew up to 20 centimetres in length and existed at the same time as some of the oldest dinosaurs. The extinct vertebrate was found to have two successive sets of teeth - baby (milk) teeth and permanent teeth.

240.title: Musk can use whistleblower claims but Twitter trial won't be delayed: Chancellor
240.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's request to add whistleblower claims to his Twitter countersuit was accepted by Chancellor Kathaleen McCormick on Wednesday. However, Musk's request to delay the trial over his bid to walk away from the $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter was rejected. "I'm convinced that even four weeks' delay would risk further harm to Twitter," McCormick said.

241.title: 'India's biggest car thief', who stole over 5,000 cars, had ₹10-crore villa and 3 wives
241.article_body: Anil Chauhan, dubbed 'India's biggest car thief' by police, owned a ₹10-crore villa and had three wives and seven children. Chauhan stole over 5,000 cars in 24 years and he is involved in over 181 cases. Police said that two of his wives claimed they didn't know about Chauhan's criminal activities and thought he was a car dealer.

242.title: Instead of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Rahul should do 'Cong Jodo Yatra': Athawale
242.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Wednesday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and said he should do a 'Congress Jodo Yatra' instead of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "PM Narendra Modi is working to connect the country," Athawale said. "Congress party is taking out a rally to create controversy in the country, that's why his Yatra is...'Bharat Todo Yatra'," Athawale added.

243.title: Cipla shares hit 52-week high as it gets USFDA nod for cancer drug
243.article_body: Cipla has announced that it received the final approval from the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) to launch the generic version of a rare blood cancer medicine. USFDA has approved its Abbreviated New Drug Application for Lenalidomide capsule. Following the announcement, Cipla's stock rose about 2% to ₹1,062, which's close to its 52-week high of ₹1,083 hit in March.

244.title: 4 killed, 3 injured as bus rams into two bikes in Rajasthan's Ajmer
244.article_body: Four people, including an infant, were killed and three others were injured after a bus rammed into two motorcycles in Rajasthan's Ajmer, police said on Wednesday. The deceased were identified as four-month-old Khushi, 28-year-old Laxmi Gurjar, 25-year-old Laxman Gurjar and 26-year-old Ganesh Bhil, police said. The injured were admitted to government hospital in Ajmer for treatment, the SHO said.

245.title: 3 drug suppliers held in Goa, will severely affect drug trade: CM
245.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said police have arrested three main drug suppliers which will severely affect the illegal drug trade in the state. "The government wants to give a strict message to tourists that our state is not for...drugs and its trade and consumption will not be entertained," Sawant said, adding nightclubs are also under police's radar.

246.title: Himachal top performer among neighbours in solving kidnapping cases: Police
246.article_body: Himachal Pradesh has become the top-performing state among its neighbours in tracing kidnapped and missing persons, state police claimed, quoting National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data. Police stated that 451 of 528 kidnapped persons were traced in 2021, recording a recovery rate of 85.4%. Himachal Pradesh stood second among states in finding kidnapped persons after Odisha, police added.

247.title: K'taka will seek aid from central govt for flood-hit areas: CM
247.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the state government will seek compensation from the Centre for damages caused due to rains. He held a meeting with the inter-ministerial central team assessing the extent of damages caused due to floods. "The team was asked to take stock of the flood situation in Bengaluru, Mandya and Ramanagar," a statement by CM's office said.

248.title: Centre to soon issue guidelines for social media influencers: Report
248.article_body: The Centre will soon issue guidelines for social media influencers mandating them to disclose paid promotions, ET Now reported. The Consumer Affairs Ministry is likely to issue a standard operating procedure in next 10 days. The guidelines will reportedly include a financial penalty of ₹10 lakh for first offence, ₹20 lakh for second offence and ₹50 lakh for continuous violations.

249.title: KRK gets bail week after arrest over derogatory tweets on Akshay Kumar
249.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan, popularly known as KRK, was granted bail by a magistrate court in Mumbai's Borivali in the 2020 derogatory tweets case. He was arrested last week over his tweets on actor Akshay Kumar and filmmaker Ram Gopal Verma. Khan is likely to be released from the Thane jail on Thursday, his lawyer said.

250.title: Alia probably had the best year in the history of actors: Ranbir
250.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said Alia Bhatt has "probably had the best year any artist has ever had, in the history of actors" with 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', 'RRR', 'Darlings' and now, 'Brahmastra'. Ranbir said while he loved 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', he became Alia's "huge admirer" after 'Highway'. He said 'Highway' gave birth to an actor that "Indian cinema and world cinema weren't ready for".

251.title: Centre accords Z+ security cover to former President Ram Nath Kovind
251.article_body: Centre has accorded 'Z plus' category security cover of a central paramilitary force to ex-President Ram Nath Kovind, officials have confirmed. He will be granted the armed escort on an all-India basis and the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) VIP security commando unit will render the task, officials said. Kovind's residence located on Delhi's Janpath Road will also be secured.

252.title: Inflation has eased to manageable level: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
252.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday said inflation has eased to a manageable level in India in the past few months. "Some...are red-lettered (priorities), some may not be. Red-lettered ones would...be jobs, equitable wealth distribution," she said. "In that sense, inflation is not red-lettered," she added. As per data, retail inflation softened to 6.71% in July in India.

253.title: Labour groups, investors ask Apple to review how it treats workers' rights
253.article_body: Labour groups and unions have filed a shareholder proposal asking Apple to review how it treats workers' rights. The proposal, filed by a group including SOC Investment Group, accuses Apple of an "apparent misalignment" between its public commitments to issues like freedom of association and accusations that it has tried to unfairly deter union organising.

254.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh shares pics of horse gifted to him by Mongolian President
254.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh took to Twitter to share pictures of horse gifted to him by Mongolian President Ukhnaagiin Khurelsukh during his visit to Mongolia. "A special gift from our special friends in Mongolia. I've named this magnificent beauty, 'Tejas'. Thank you...President  Khurelsukh. Thank you Mongolia," he tweeted. Rajnath Singh is the first Indian Defence Minister to visit Mongolia.

255.title: Kashmiri MBBS student dies in B'desh; Omar asks MEA to repatriate body
255.article_body: A female MBBS student from J&K's Anantnag who was pursuing her MBBS degree in Bangladesh died there on Wednesday after a mishap. The victim, Khusboo Manzur, reportedly fell from her college's hostel building on Tuesday and succumbed to her injuries a day later. Former J&K CMs Omar Abdullah and Mehbooba Mufti have sought the MEA's help in repatriating her body.

256.title: Still the boy who cherishes time with you: Dulquer on Mammootty
256.article_body: On Mammootty's birthday, actor Dulquer Salmaan recalled how, as a child, he used to make the most of his time with his father. He said that even now, when he's home with Mammootty, time stands still for him and he becomes the boy "cherishing the time he gets when his father has a day off from work". Mammootty turned 71.

257.title: Nitish Kumar meets Sharad Pawar, says 'we are keen to unite Opp'n'
257.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, who's in Delhi to unify the Opposition ahead of the 2024 general elections, met NCP President Sharad Pawar on Wednesday. After the meeting, Kumar said, "Pawar and I are keen to unite Opposition forces who're not with the BJP." He added, "A leader of the alliance can be decided later. It's important to come together first."

258.title: 23 killed, dozens injured in karaoke bar fire in Vietnam
258.article_body: At least 23 people were killed and dozens were injured in a fire accident at a karaoke bar in south Vietnam on Tuesday night, officials said on Wednesday. The fire spread quickly as the bar had foam soundproofing and wooden panels installed, witnesses said. Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has ordered a probe into the cause of fire.

259.title: Was planning to do an album with Bamba Bakya: AR Rahman
259.article_body: Composer-singer AR Rahman remembered late playback singer Bamba Bakya at the trailer launch of Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One'. "I was planning to do an album with Bamba Bakya. Unfortunately, he left before that. I hope he's happy wherever he is," Rahman said. Bakya, who reportedly passed away due to cardiac arrest, sang 'Ponni Nadhi' for Mani Ratnam's film.

260.title: Arunachal Pradesh Assembly passes civil courts amendment bill
260.article_body: The Arunachal Pradesh Assembly on Wednesday passed a civil courts amendment bill which seeks to transfer suits pending in the courts of deputy commissioners to junior and senior division civil judges. CM Pema Khandu moved The Arunachal Pradesh Civil Courts (Amendment) Bill, 2022. The statement of the bill says the objective is to lessen the workload of regular courts.

261.title: Imagined Sridevi as Kundavai in 'Ponniyin...': Rajinikanth
261.article_body: At the trailer launch of 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One', Tamil actor Rajinikanth said he imagined late actor Sridevi in the role of Kundavai. In the Mani Ratnam directorial, Trisha plays the role of Kundavai. "When I read the story, I imagined Kamal as Arulmozhivarman, Sridevi as Kundavai, Vijaykanth as Aditya Karikalan and Sathyaraj as Pazhuvettaraiyar," he said.

262.title: It's not final report: MP CM on 'irregularities' worth over ₹100 cr in ration scheme
262.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday reacted to a report by the state's Accountant General on alleged irregularities worth over ₹100 crore in the 'Poshan-Aahar' or supplementary nutrition scheme. He said this is not the final report of the Accountant General. "This is a preliminary report...the department is yet to present its side," he added.

263.title: Over 1 lakh Brahmāstra tickets sold, biggest advance for Hindi film post pandemic: Report
263.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's 'Brahmāstra' has sold over one lakh tickets in advance booking, as per reports. The film reportedly has the highest advance bookings for a Hindi original, since the COVID-19 pandemic. It has already exceeded the advance booking collection of Kartik Aaryan's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', reports added.

264.title: Seat-belts are important, so is fixing potholes: Pooja Bhatt
264.article_body: Pooja Bhatt said fixing potholes and damaged roads is as important as wearing seat-belts. "When will the usage of substandard material to build our roads, highways, freeways be deemed criminal?" she asked in a tweet. She said "maintaining those roads once built & inaugurated with pomp is key". The tweet came days after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's death.

265.title: Russia continues shelling areas near nuclear power plant: Ukraine
265.article_body: Russia has shelled areas near Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine, a Ukrainian official said on Wednesday. The reports of shelling come as experts from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) inspected the plant over the weekend. Later, the IAEA said it is "still gravely concerned about the situation" but there was no indication of a "proliferation concern."

266.title: Video of man helping dog on flooded B'luru road goes viral
266.article_body: A video on social media wherein a man is helping a dog wade through a flooded road in Bengaluru has gone viral. The video, which has received over 11,000 views, was posted by actor and former Lok Sabha member Divya Spandana on her Twitter account. A user commented "let small ray of hope widen further", while another wrote "good job".

267.title: India, US combined GDP expected to be $70 trillion by 2050: Adani
267.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has said the combined value of India and the United States Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is expected to be $70 trillion by 2050. "It will make up 35-40% of the global economy," he stated. "The existing $150 billion bilateral trade between India and...US is no more than a speck in the ocean," he said further.

268.title: Man gets only salan on ordering 'inter-city' biryani in Gurugram, shares pic
268.article_body: A Gurugram-based man said he placed an order for biryani using Zomato's new inter-city food delivery service. However, he was only delivered a portion of salan. "It's a double loss for me. As...customer and as...shareholder," he tweeted. The man later said Zomato officials managed to track his order and also sent him extra biryani.

269.title: Goyal launches SETU, aims to connect Indian startups to US investors
269.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce, Piyush Goyal, launched Supporting Entrepreneurs for Transformation and Upskilling (SETU), which is an initiative aimed at connecting Indian startups with US investors. Citing lack of mentorship as a reason why some startups fail, he urged US entrepreneurs to participate. Encouraging investments in India, Goyal also highlighted the huge market potential of the country.

270.title: MP man denied bowls & spoons at samosa shop calls CM helpline
270.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur recently called the CM helpline number to complain about an eatery denying him bowls and spoons. "There's a shop named Rakesh Samosa at Chhatarpur bus stand...person who gets...samosa packed here is not given a spoon or...bowl. Please get the problem resolved ASAP," his complaint stated. The helpline, however, disposed of his complaint.

271.title: Robber sprays black paint on CCTV before blowing up ATM & looting ₹11 lakh in Maha
271.article_body: A robber sprayed black paint on a CCTV camera at an ATM before blowing up the machine and looting ₹11 lakh in Maharashtra's Satara on Wednesday. The accused used explosive materials such as gelatin for the blast. A video of the incident shows the man covering his face with his hand while spraying the paint on the CCTV camera.

272.title: Solar Orbiter hit by mass ejection from Sun during Venus flyby
272.article_body: On September 4, the European Space Agency's (ESA) Solar Orbiter was approaching Venus for a flyby when it was hit by a coronal mass ejection, the space agency said. "Fortunately...there were no negative effects on the spacecraft as ESA-NASA solar observatory is designed to withstand and in fact measure violent outbursts from our star," ESA said.

273.title: Flight ops at B'luru airport have returned to normalcy: Official
273.article_body: Flight operations at Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru, which were affected following heavy rains over the weekend, have returned to complete normalcy, a spokesperson said. On Monday from 1 am to 3 am, six flights at the Bengaluru airport were diverted to Chennai and nine services were delayed. The spokesperson said since then all flights have been maintaining schedule.

274.title: Traffic movement to be restricted in Mumbai on Sept 9 for Ganesh Visarjan
274.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police has imposed traffic restrictions on September 9 in view of Ganesh Visarjan. Overall, 74 roads will be closed to vehicular traffic, 54 roads will only allow vehicular traffic going one way, 57 roads won't allow heavy vehicles and 114 locations will have parking restrictions. These restrictions will be in effect from 12:00 pm to 6:00 am.

275.title: J&K court refuses to dismiss UAPA case against college professor
275.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh HC refused to dismiss a case registered under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) against a college professor accused of inciting violence. Abdul Bari Naik has been charged with allegedly trying to provoke citizens to use force against the army and police. Police submitted video clips to court which purportedly showed Naik promoting enmity.

276.title: Car catches fire in Pune, lightning strike suspected reason
276.article_body: A car in the parking bay of an automobile sales company in Pune's Viman Nagar caught fire on Wednesday afternoon. The staffers at the facility said a lightning strike caused the fire, fire brigade officials said. No damages to other cars were reported in the incident. We brought the fire under control within minutes, said fire officer Sopan Pawar.

277.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra is a hollow, 'family-saving campaign': BJP
277.article_body: BJP on Wednesday termed Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as "hollow" and alleged that it was essentially a "family-saving campaign", for the Gandhis to keep control over the party. The family's political expanse has been shrinking while they face corruption charges, said BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad, adding that the campaign is another attempt at re-establishing Rahul Gandhi as a leader.

278.title: AAP releases 3rd list of 10 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
278.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has released the third list of 10 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. AAP has nominated former Congress leader Kailash Gadhvi from Mandvi Assembly seat in Kutch district, Dinesh Kapadia from Danilimda and Praful Vasava from Nandod. Kalpesh Patel Bholabhai, Jeevan Jungi and Lalesh Thakkar have been nominated from Vejalpur, Porbandar and Patan, respectively.

279.title: Water supply in some areas of eastern Pune to be disrupted on Sept 11
279.article_body: Water supply in some areas of eastern Pune will be disrupted on September 11 to facilitate the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited in carrying out urgent maintenance work. Pune Municipal Corporation informed that the affected areas include Viman Nagar, Vadgaon Sheri, Kalyani Nagar and Vishrantwadi. Water supply is likely to be restored late in the morning on September 12.

280.title: Release ₹383 cr for education & health pending for 2 yrs: Delhi LG to Kejriwal
280.article_body: Delhi LG V K Saxena has written to CM Arvind Kejriwal directing him to immediately release ₹383.74 crore for education and health sectors to municipal corporations pending for two years, Raj Niwas Delhi said in a statement on Wednesday. Holding the fund "without any reason" was adversely impacting primary education and health in Delhi, he reportedly said in the letter.

281.title: Mumbai man steals ₹15 cr from employer, loses all money in gambling
281.article_body: An accountant, who had stolen over ₹15 crore from his employer in Mumbai, lost all the money in online gambling, Borivali Police said. Kapil Ramanlal Khunt had siphoned the money from Mansi Shares and Stock Advisors' bank accounts. He went missing after informing the company's owners that he lost the money in gambling. Police found ₹16,437 in Khunt's bank account.

282.title: US bans 'advanced tech' firms from building facilities in China for 10 years
282.article_body: The US government announced technology companies that receive federal funding will be barred from building "advanced technology" facilities in China for 10 years. The guidelines were unveiled as part of a $50-billion plan aimed at building up local semiconductor industry. "Companies who receive...money can only expand mature node factories in China to serve...Chinese market," the White House said.

283.title: United Airlines may end JFK airport service if more flights not approved
283.article_body: United Airlines said it will end services to John F. Kennedy Airport (JFK) in October if the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) doesn't allow additional flights. In a statement, FAA said it must consider airspace and runway capacity to assess how changes would affect flights at nearby airports. United flies twice daily to San Francisco and Los Angeles from JFK.

284.title: 10 DMK MLAs are in touch with us to switch sides: AIADMK's EPS
284.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday claimed that 10 DMK MLAs are in touch with his faction to switch sides. "Though Tamil Nadu has many political parties, everyone has affection for AIADMK," Palaniswami said. EPS also alleged that AIADMK MP Ravindhranath, who is AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam's son, shares a close bond with DMK.

285.title: Bed Bath & Beyond names interim CFO after executive's death
285.article_body: Bed Bath & Beyond has named Laura Crossen as the interim Chief Financial Officer (CFO). She will continue serving as the company's principal accounting officer. According to the New York City Police Department, 52-year-old Gustavo Arnal fell from the 57-storey Jenga residential tower in Manhattan last week. The medical examiner's office said Arnal died by suicide.

286.title: I-T Dept raids business, residential premises of Raj Home Minister
286.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Wednesday conducted raids on business and residential premises belonging to Rajasthan Home Minister Rajendra Yadav and his family. The raids were conducted in Kotputli and Uttarakhand. The Congress MLA and his family have a business of packaging material and food products. "It's our ancestral business since 1950...My politics and business are both clean," Yadav said.

287.title: Hyderabad think tank demands toddy ban in city due to adulteration
287.article_body: A Hyderabad-based think tank has called for a complete ban on toddy sale in the city, alleging that it's adulterated. Citing the Toddy policy, the Forum for Good Governance (FGG) said that no palm trees exist within a 50 km radius of the city. The forum has also asked the state to chemically examine the toddy available in the market.

288.title: Hyderabad Mayor launches fever test program in NBT Nagar
288.article_body: Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal along with GHMC zonal commissioner of Khairatabad launched the fever test program in NBT Nagar where most number of dengue cases were registered. "At least every Sunday...for 10 minutes all the family members should participate in cleaning the surroundings," Gadwal said. She further urged people to be alert to prevent the spread of diseases during monsoons.

289.title: Dengue cases rise in Greater Hyd, govt launches door-to-door survey
289.article_body: As dengue cases rise in Greater Hyderabad and other parts of the state, the Telangana government has launched a door-to-door survey to create awareness about the disease. Over 1,800 cases were reported in August in the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits. GHMC officials will go from house to house and sanitise areas that are reporting higher cases.

290.title: Lost my father to politics of hate, won't lose country to it: Rahul
290.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said, "I lost my father to the politics of hate and division. I'll not lose my beloved country to it too." "Love will conquer hate. Hope will defeat fear," Gandhi tweeted. This comes after he paid tributes at his father and ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi's memorial in Tamil Nadu's Sriperumbudur ahead of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

291.title: Tencent raises stake in 'Assassin's Creed' maker Ubisoft
291.article_body: Chinese tech giant Tencent Holdings is raising its stake in France's Ubisoft Entertainment, the maker of 'Assassin's Creed' and 'Tom Clancy's' franchises. Tencent will pay €200 million euros ($198 million) to buy an indirect stake in Ubisoft and will invest a further €100 million in Guillemot Brothers. The pact involves Tencent's acquisition of 49.9% of Guillemot Brothers, Ubisoft said.

292.title: Fire breaks out in Noida Sector-18 building, dozen people saved from 2nd & 3rd floors
292.article_body: A fire broke out in a building in Noida Sector-18 market on Wednesday. Chief Fire Officer Arun Singh said, "A dozen people were stuck on the second and third floors of the building. We safely evacuated all of them. There were no casualties." He added that four fire tenders are deployed at the spot and the fire is under control.

293.title: Arshdeep is a confident guy & that's why he's here, ahead of a lot of people: Rohit
293.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma praised Arshdeep Singh for his performances, stating that the 23-year-old is a "confident guy" and they are happy with the way he approaches his game. "I haven't seen many people like that in their early days when they're playing for India," added Rohit. On Arshdeep's catch drop against Pakistan, Rohit said, "Arshdeep was himself disappointed."

294.title: IT Rules amendments to be rolled out in next few days: Union Minister
294.article_body: Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar said on Wednesday that the amendments to the Information Technology Rules, 2021 will be brought in the next few days. He added that a series of new legislation such as a revised bill on data protection and the Digital India Act will be rolled out in three-four months, however, these will be subject to stakeholder consultation.

295.title: Retail-tech startup Daalchini raises $4 million in Series A round
295.article_body: Retail-tech startup Daalchini has raised $4 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Unicorn India Ventures and saw participation from Artha Venture Fund, Ajay Kaul (former CEO of Domino's India) and Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's investment vertical. The startup was founded in 2017 by former Paytm employees Prerna Kalra and Vidya Bhushan.

296.title: Man tries to kidnap 6-yr-old girl from Mumbai's Ganpati mandal, fails
296.article_body: A man tried to kidnap a six-year-old girl playing at a Ganpati mandal near her home in Mumbai's Kandivali (East) on Tuesday, police said. The man allegedly picked her up on his shoulder on the pretext of showing her more Ganpati idols and started running away. He dropped the girl and escaped when the girl's father's friend confronted him.

297.title: Condemn Kejriwal's '80% of govt schools worse than junkyards' remark: Minister
297.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Tuesday criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for alleging that "80% of government schools in the country are worse than junkyards". "Since they've come to power in Delhi, the enrolment of students in government schools decreased," he said. It's unfortunate that those busy with liquor stores are calling schools junkyards, said BJP leader Anurag Thakur.

298.title: Former IT Secy joins Tiger Global-backed Ninjacart's advisory board
298.article_body: Tiger Global-backed agritech startup Ninjacart set up an advisory board comprising former Food and Agriculture Secretary T Nandakumar and J Satyanarayana, former Information Technology Secretary of the central government, among others. The advisory board will help in developing long-term strategies, the firm said. RBI's retired Deputy Governor Anand Sinha also joined the board.

299.title: Massive fire erupts at firecracker factory in UP's Bijnor; video surfaces
299.article_body: A massive fire broke out in a firecracker factory in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor on Wednesday. According to police, the fire may have started after a spark came in contact with the powder being filled inside the firecrackers. No injuries were reported from the fire. The fire was brought under control using the factory's own fire suppression provisions, police said.

300.title: Jewellery shop owner shot, stabbed to death on road in Ghaziabad
300.article_body: A 35-year-old jewellery store owner was shot and stabbed to death by two assailants on a road in Ghaziabad on Monday. The incident took place when the assailants tried to snatch the man's bag containing gold and silver jewellery. However, the locals managed to capture one of the shooters, while the second attacker was captured by police the next day.

301.title: Woman set afire by husband in Delhi after she refused to pay ₹5 lakh dowry
301.article_body: A 33-year-old woman was reportedly set ablaze by her husband and father-in-law over dowry in East Delhi's Mandawali. The accused reportedly poured kerosene on her and set her afire after she refused to pay them a ₹5 lakh dowry. She sustained 40% burn injuries. Delhi Commission for Women has sent a notice to the police demanding action against the accused.

302.title: Pune man slips while deboarding moving train; saved by RPF personnel
302.article_body: A man recently lost his balance and slipped on the platform while deboarding a moving train in Pune. A video shared by the Ministry of Railways showed the man coming close to the gap between the platform and the moving train when he's saved by Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel. "The vigilance of...RPF employee saved [his life]!" the ministry tweeted.

303.title: Venture capitalists invested $14.2 bn in crypto in H1 2022: Report
303.article_body: A Cointelegraph report found that venture capital (VC) firms contributed $14.2 billion into cryptocurrencies across 725 deals in H1 2022. According to KPMG, investments are likely to remain slow for the rest of the year. Majority of investments in H1 2022 reportedly came from Germany's Trade Republic, digital asset custody firm Fireblocks, cryptocurrency exchange FTX and software firm ConsenSys.

304.title: Bihar government to recycle seized liquor bottles into bangles
304.article_body: The Bihar government has decided to recycle the glass from seized liquor bottles into bangles. The state government has made an agreement with a bangle manufacturing unit in Uttar Pradesh that will train women in making bangles from these bottles. According to state excise commissioner, B Kartikey Dhanji, women engaged with Livelihood Mission (Jivika) would be employed for manufacturing bangles.

305.title: 2 arrested for theft, circulation of fake currency notes in B'luru
305.article_body: Police have arrested two people for alleged theft and circulating fake currency notes in Bengaluru. The accused had over 20 cases registered against them relating to house break-ins, burglary and chain snatching. Police have seized notes worth over ₹3 lakh from the suspects and 46 grams of gold. Two more were arrested for stealing bikes.

306.title: Set up grievance cells in each ward for those affected by floods: HC to BBMP
306.article_body: Karnataka HC on Wednesday directed Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to immediately set up cells to address grievances of those affected by heavy rains and a flood-like situation in Bengaluru. The cell, which will be set up in each ward, will have an engineer to attend to grievances. BBMP has been directed to expedite state government's approval for the cells.

307.title: Video shows MP health staffer getting massage from minor, gets notice
307.article_body: Health authorities have issued a show-cause notice to a hospital staffer after a video purportedly showed a minor boy massaging his legs in a government medical facility in MP's Shahdol, an official said on Wednesday. The incident occurred last week and the video surfaced online on Tuesday, in which the hospital staffer can be seen sitting on a chair.

308.title: How can India still qualify for Asia Cup final after losing to Sri Lanka?
308.article_body: After losing against Sri Lanka on Tuesday, India are currently third on Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage points table. India will require Pakistan to lose both their matches (against Afghanistan and Sri Lanka). India would also need to beat Afghanistan by a big margin. India would then need their NRR to be higher than that of Pakistan and Afghanistan.

309.title: Team management needs to take calls on Jadeja's workload: Karim
309.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has said not only Ravindra Jadeja but the team management also needs to take calls regarding the all-rounder's workload. "Jadeja is such a player who adds value in all three formats...It's very important for the medical team...to manage his workload," stated Karim. Jadeja has been ruled out of Asia Cup due to a knee injury.

310.title: Non-bailable warrant issued against Bobby Kataria over smoking video
310.article_body: A Delhi court has issued a non-bailable warrant against social media influencer Bobby Kataria. A case was registered against him after a video showing him smoking a cigarette on board a SpiceJet flight in January went viral. Deputy Commissioner of Police, IGI Airport, Tanu Sharma, said Kataria has been on the run since the case was registered.

311.title: 18 underground Delhi metro stations to get full-height platform screen doors
311.article_body: A total of 18 underground stations of the upcoming Phase IV project of Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) are going to have full-height platform screen doors (PSD) like the ones used on the Airport Express Line stations. The full-height PSDs would operate as a complete glass barrier, and the doors would only open in sync with train doors.

312.title: 65-yr-old woman's body found in well in Thane; case registered
312.article_body: The body of a 65-year-old woman, Sharada Murlidhar Burse, was found in a well in Thane on Wednesday morning, a civic official said. Local police informed us that some persons had spotted the body floating in the well, Thane Municipal Corporation's Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief said. Police have registered a case of accidental death and are investigating it.

313.title: Agri-fintech firm Ayekart raises $5.5 mn in equity & debt fund round
313.article_body: Integrated tech firm Ayekart has secured $5.5 million through an equity and debt fund round from Caspian Debt, a corporate lending financial services company, and Siply, a micro financial services platform. The company aims to use the funds by providing businesses in the Food and Agriculture sector with financial and technological assistance. Ayekart began its commercial rollout in September 2021.

314.title: Best to tone down your expectation: Ashneer on EaseMyTrip Co-founder's chat with candidate
314.article_body: EaseMyTrip Co-founder Prashant Pitti recently shared a chat with a candidate who dropped out on the joining day. While Pitti called it a "prevalent" issue, BharatPe's ex-MD tweeted, "In India there's no value of contract...In India it’s- ek haath le doosre haath de. Best to tone down your expectation that you employ daily wagers in guise of salaried folk."

315.title: Video shows ambulance being made to wait for Amit Shah's convoy, Mumbai Police clarify
315.article_body: After a controversy erupted over a video purportedly showing an ambulance being made to wait for Union Home Minister Amit Shah's convoy to pass, Mumbai Police have issued a clarification. "It has been verified there was no emergency patient in the ambulance and due to defect, the ambulance van driver was unable to switch off the siren," Mumbai Police said.

316.title: 28-yr-old man attacked on suspicion of being police informer in Thane
316.article_body: A 28-year-old man was attacked by a gang of chain snatchers on suspicion of being a police informer in Thane, an official said. The incident occurred on Tuesday when Jaffar Yusuf (Ashok) Irani, was having food at a Ganesh pandal in Lahuji Nagar. The five accused allegedly sprayed something on Irani's face and attacked him with weapons, the official added.

317.title: Man killed by elephant in West Bengal's Jhargram, 7th death in 15 days
317.article_body: A 46-year-old man was trampled to death by a wild elephant in West Bengal's Jhargram district on Wednesday. The deceased, identified as Parimal Pal, was cutting a tree in a forest when he was attacked, officials said. Notably, this is the seventh person to be killed in attack by wild elephants in the district in last 15 days.

318.title: We support all peaceful efforts to end Russia-Ukraine conflict: PM
318.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday virtually addressed the Plenary Session of the 7th Eastern Economic Forum being held in Russia. Speaking on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, PM Modi said, "From the very beginning of the Ukraine conflict, we have emphasized the need to adopt the path of diplomacy and dialogue." "We support all peaceful efforts to end this conflict," he added.

319.title: 26-yr-old man killed in Chhattisgarh over suspicion of stealing utensils
319.article_body: Four men were arrested for allegedly killing a 26-year-old man over suspicion of stealing utensils in a village in the Jashpur district of Chhattisgarh, police said. They were booked under relevant sections of IPC. The accused purportedly hit the victim with sticks. "The victim was rushed to a nearby hospital where he died on Tuesday," a police official said.

320.title: India's digital revolution gives investment opportunities to US: FM
320.article_body: India's digital revolution offers investment opportunities for US firms and investors, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, adding that "India's Open Network for Digital Commerce has revolutionised the retail and manufacturing sector". Sitharaman said at the US-India Business Council's India Ideas Summit that she saw scope for collaboration between India and the US in the digital sector.

321.title: K'taka IT Minister to discuss B'luru flooding with software firms
321.article_body: Amid unprecedented rains in Bengaluru, Karnataka's Minister for Information Technology, Biotechnology CN Ashwathnarayan will meet the representatives of software companies on Wednesday to discuss the problems faced by the companies due to the rain. Companies such as Infosys, Wipro, Emphasis, Nasscom, Goldman Sachs, Intel, TCS, Philips and Sonata Software, among others will attend the meeting.

322.title: 73-yr-old man kills wife with bat in U'khand after she refused to make dinner
322.article_body: A 73-year-old man was arrested in Dehradun for allegedly beating his 53-year-old wife to death using a cricket bat on Monday evening, police said. The couple used to have frequent quarrels and a heated argument ensued between them after the woman refused to make dinner, police added. The accused called the ambulance. Later, doctors at the hospital declared her dead.

323.title: Pune residents use bridge before civic body's official inauguration
323.article_body: Pune residents have started using the bridge connecting Pashan to Sus Gaon before its official inauguration by the Pune Municipal Corporation, owing to the constant changing of completion dates, as per reports. "They gave us three deadlines- August 2021, August 15, 2022, and August 31...bridge was ready...it seems they have no one to officially inaugurate it," a resident said.

324.title: Policeman jumps off 12th-floor apartment with wife, daughter in Gujarat
324.article_body: A 35-year-old police constable allegedly jumped off his 12th-floor apartment along with his 28-year-old wife and their two-year-old daughter in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Wednesday, officials said. "He was a police constable posted at Vastrapur Police Station for the last three years," a policeman said. "We do not know the reason yet. An investigation is going on," he added.

325.title: Mumbai jail authority denies ex-CM Thackeray permission to meet Raut
325.article_body: Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail authority denied former CM Uddhav Thackeray the permission to meet jailed leader Sanjay Raut, who was arrested in connection with a money laundering case. The authority said that Thackeray would have to get court's permission for it. "They will have to meet in the same way as ordinary prisoners meet," it said.

326.title: You'll not get a better option than Shami for T20 WC: Irfan Pathan
326.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said if Team India wants to include another pacer in their preparation for the upcoming T20 World Cup, then they won't get a better option than Mohammad Shami. "There are options, but they are young and inexperienced. If you see experience and form, Mohammad Shami is furthest ahead," stated Irfan.

327.title: Country on 'Kartavya Path' but Congress on 'Ghulami Ka Parivar Path': Poonawalla
327.article_body: BJP's National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticised Congress after Robert Vadra's photo appeared on the poster of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said that the move is not about 'Bharat Jodo' but 'Parivar Ko Jodo'. Giving reference to the new name given to Rajpath, Poonawalla said, "Country is on Kartavya Path (path of duty) but Congress is on 'Ghulami Ka Parivar Path'."

328.title: Video shows crocodile roaming on streets in Shahjahanpur, triggers panic
328.article_body: A video showing a crocodile roaming around the streets in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur has gone viral on social media. The reptile reportedly moved out of a rainy drain and started roaming around the roads. Seeing the reptile on the road, the locals in Shahjahanpur reportedly panicked.

329.title: BJP leader, 21 others booked after man beaten to death in UP
329.article_body: A local BJP leader and 21 others were booked after a man was beaten to death in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi district on Tuesday. Police said an argument broke out when Mustqueem's goat strayed into his neighbour's house. Later at night, BJP leader Ashok Kumar Jaiswal and others allegedly barged into Mustqueem's home and thrashed him and his family, police added.

330.title: Maha CM to visit 12 Ganesh mandals, visit Nana Patekar in Pune on Wednesday
330.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde will offer prayers at more than a dozen Ganesh mandals in Pune and visit the residence of actor Nana Patekar on Wednesday, reports said. CM Shinde will offer prayers at the Ganesh idol installed by Patekar. Leaders of several political parties have been visiting the Ganesh mandals.

331.title: Parents rejected films after 'Iqbal' for me to have normal life: Shweta
331.article_body: Actress Shweta Basu Prasad, who featured as a child actress in the 2002 film 'Makdee' and the 2005 film 'Iqbal', said that her parents rejected several movies after 'Iqbal'. "They said no to Rajkumar Santoshi's 'Halla Bol' and Madhur Bhandarkar's 'Traffic Signal' because they wanted me to study and have a normal life," she revealed.

332.title: Who’s Jairam Ramesh? Was never close to any man with such name: Assam CM
332.article_body: Following Congress leader Jairam Ramesh's statement over Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' remark, Sarma said, "First, tell me who Jairam Ramesh is?" "I was never very close to any man with such a name when I was in Congress," Sarma added. Ramesh had said, "I think Assam CM is boyish and immature."

333.title: Govt to build another 46 km cycle track around Hyd's Gandipet: KTR
333.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao announced that the government is planning to build another 46 km cycle track around Gandipet. KTR made the announcement after laying foundation stone for solar-roofed cycling track in Hyderabad. "Ananthagiri Hills, Kotepally Lake and a portion of Vikarabad would also be transformed into tourist destinations," KTR added.

334.title: 1,240 people died in Pune in 2020 as they weren't wearing seatbelt: Data
334.article_body: According to data shared by the highway traffic police, not wearing seatbelts and helmets were among the major causes of road fatalities in Pune jurisdiction. As many as 1,240 people died in 2020 in Pune as they were not wearing seatbelts, according to the Maharashtra Highway Traffic Police website. Similarly, 4,878 people died in Pune as they weren't wearing helmets.

335.title: Working with Ekta Kapoor is an honour, have seen her grow up: Big B
335.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, speaking about working with producer Ekta Kapoor in his upcoming film 'Goodbye', has said that it was an honour to work with her. "I've seen Ekta growing up since her childhood...I've seen her films and have loved them," Amitabh added. Ekta said she visited Amitabh's house during her childhood as Shweta and Abhishek Bachchan were her friends.

336.title: I'm just devastated, it's heartbreaking: Kyrgios after US Open defeat
336.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said he's devastated after losing to Karen Khachanov in their US Open quarter-final. "I'm just devastated. Just feel like it was either winning it all or nothing at all...I feel like I've just failed at this event right now," he stated. Khachanov won with a scoreline of 7-5, 4-6, 7-5, 6-7 (3-7), 6-4.

337.title: Duo arrested for selling fake grocery products in Hyderabad
337.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested two people for operating a fake grocery-selling racket and seized items worth ₹6.74 lakh. The two accused bought fake grocery items from Rajasthan and sold them to retailers at a profit. The duo sold fake products like Red Label tea powder, Chakra Gold tea powder, Parachute oil and Lizol among other popular household brand products.

338.title: Arshdeep Singh stops and stares at man abusing him in front of team bus, video goes viral
338.article_body: India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh stopped and stared at a man who abused him while he was boarding the team bus after India's defeat to Sri Lanka on Tuesday. In the video, the man can be heard mocking Arshdeep for dropping a catch against Pakistan. Senior journalist Vimal Kumar confronted the man for his behaviour after which the man apologised.

339.title: Chelsea sack manager Thomas Tuchel after 100 days of new ownership
339.article_body: Chelsea today sacked their manager Thomas Tuchel after the club suffered a defeat against Dinamo Zagreb in their first Champions League match this season. "As the new ownership group reaches 100 days since taking over the club, and as it continues its hard work to take the club forward...new owners believe it's...right time to make this transition," the club said.

340.title: Pet dog attacks man in Noida housing society lift after Ghaziabad incident, video surfaces
340.article_body: After a video showing a pet dog biting a boy inside a housing society lift in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad went viral, another video of a dog attack in Noida has surfaced. The latest incident occurred in Apex Athena society in Sector 75 in Noida, where a man was attacked in the lift by a pet dog of a boy.

341.title: Arvind Kejriwal writes letter to PM, says '80% of govt schools are worse than junkyards'
341.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, saying that 80% of government schools in India are worse than junkyards. Referring to the Pradhan Mantri Schools For Rising India (PM-SHRI) scheme for upgradation of 14,500 government schools, Kejriwal noted that there are more than 10 lakh government schools in India and stated that all should be upgraded together.

342.title: Spreading hate in name of caste, religion can lead to civil war: Raj CM
342.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday criticised BJP, claiming hate has spread in the country in the name of caste and religion and it can lead to a civil war if it remains unchecked. "We will all work together under Rahul Gandhi's leadership'', Gehlot said, adding that it will be easier to solve big challenges if Gandhi becomes party chief.

343.title: Thieves dressed as policemen rob jewellery, cash worth ₹50 lakh in Bihar
343.article_body: Thieves dressed as policemen robbed a trader of jewellery and cash worth ₹50 lakh while he was on his way to Bihar's Chhapra Junction. The victim said the thieves asked him to accompany them as there was a complaint against him. They then tied his hands and covered his eyes before looting his bag containing the jewellery and cash.

344.title: Jharkhand CM plays drum during tribal harvest festival in Ranchi
344.article_body: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren was spotted playing a traditional drum called mandar in Ranchi on Tuesday evening on the occasion of Karam Puja, a tribal harvest festival. A video showed onlookers cheering and clapping as Soren played the traditional instrument. This comes after Soren won the trust vote in the Jharkhand Assembly on Monday.

345.title: Juul to pay $438.5 million to settle US states' probe into underage vaping marketing
345.article_body: Juul Labs has agreed to pay $438.5 million in a settlement following an investigation lasting two years by at least 33 US' states into the electric cigarette maker's marketing of vaping products containing high levels of nicotine. The states claimed that Juul's marketing downplayed its products' risks and targeted underage buyers. The FDA had briefly banned Juul's e-cigarettes in June.

346.title: Minor dies while undergoing treatment for stomach pain in Noida; doctor booked
346.article_body: Police have booked a doctor from a clinic in Sarfabad village in Noida's Sector 72 for negligence after a 15-year-old boy died while undergoing treatment for stomach pain. "The accused gave him some medicines pursuant to which he fell...sick and succumbed to his illness," a police official said. "We're investigating if...medical degree of the accused is authentic," he added.

347.title: Need to improve infrastructure: Goenka on video of flooded luxury apartment in B'luru
347.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka took to Twitter to share a video of flooding in Epsilon, an upscale residential apartment in Bengaluru. He wrote, "Scenes from the finest housing society Epsilon...where the rich and famous stay. If the city wants to continue the moniker of 'IT capital of the world', we've to improve the infrastructure of the city."

348.title: AAP MP Sanjay Singh tears legal notice sent by Delhi LG; party shares video
