348.article_body: AAP on Wednesday shared a video of its Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh tearing the legal notice sent by Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena. Saxena had sent the notice over allegations Singh made against him in connection with the ₹1,400-crore 'Khadi scam'. While tearing the notice, Singh said, "The Constitution of India gives me the right to speak the truth."

349.title: Catfight is misogynistic term, do we call men fighting 'dog fight'?: Huma
349.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi has said that 'catfight' is a misogynistic term. "Men also fight, we don't call them dog fights, do we? People fight because they don't get along and it's not about their gender," she added. Huma further added, "I think a lot more is made out about women competing with each other. I think men compete far more."

350.title: Deserves to be reunited with family: HC grants bail to boy booked for gangrape
350.article_body: The Bombay HC, while granting bail to a boy booked for the gangrape of a seven-year-old girl in 2020, said that a child can't be denied the right to be reunited with his family. The court last month said that the applicant's education can't be discontinued further and that being reunited with his family will allow him to develop himself.

351.title: 33 contractors fined ₹50 lakh over poor quality of roads in Pune
351.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has fined 33 contractors ₹50 lakh during the defect liability period over poor quality of the roads in the city. According to the civic body officials, contractors are fined ₹5,000 for every square metre of pothole. "The list of bad contractors is currently being put together. They shall receive harsh punishment," a PMC official said.

352.title: 11 Karnataka education officials arrested in teachers' recruitment case
352.article_body: Karnataka Police arrested 11 education officials on Tuesday in connection with the alleged irregularities in the grade-2 assistant teachers' recruitment process in 2012-13 and 2014-15. Those arrested are accused of illegally recruiting two assistant teachers in Tumkur. In 2014-15, 11 "unqualified" teachers were recruited under grade-2 assistant teachers and grade-1 language teachers categories.

353.title: Madrassas demolished in Assam were Al-Qaeda offices: CM Sarma
353.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday said that all madrassas that were recently demolished in the state were "not madrassas but Al-Qaeda offices". "We demolished two-three and now the public is coming to demolish others. Muslim community is coming to demolish, saying that they don't want a madrassa where the work of Al-Qaeda is done," he said.

354.title: Trying to fix something that's not broken: Uthappa on India's approach
354.article_body: Talking about India's defeats in the ongoing Asia Cup, Robin Uthappa said India are trying "too many things" in their recent matches. "[They're] trying to fix something that is not broken," stated Uthappa. "Be as aggressive as you want, but if you don't have wickets at the back end, you're always going to be under the pump," he added.

355.title: BJP's Rath Yatra was for satta, Congress' Bharat Jodo is for satya: Kanhaiya
355.article_body: BJP's 1990 Rath Yatra was for seeking "satta (power)", but Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is for "satya (truth)", Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar said on Wednesday. "It represents the thinking of the country that is enshrined in the Preamble of the Constitution," Kanhaiya added. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will launch the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari at around 5 pm today.

356.title: Drunk domestic help kills J'khand couple in sleep after fight over food
356.article_body: A 40-year-old man, in a drunk state, allegedly axed a couple to death in their sleep and critically injured their daughter, following an argument over food in Jharkhand's Gumla district, police said. The accused said that he had an argument with the deceased a few days back and feared that his employer would murder him, a police official said.

357.title: Thane man kills mother, hangs her body from fan to pass it off as suicide
357.article_body: A 34-year-old man was booked for allegedly killing his 50-year-old mother in Thane. The accused reportedly strangulated her on Monday morning following a quarrel and later hung her body from a ceiling fan with a cloth to pass it off as a case of suicide. The accused used to have frequent quarrels with the deceased over domestic and monetary issues.

358.title: Parts of Pakistan look like a sea: Pak PM as deaths rise to 1,343
358.article_body: Parts of Pakistan look "like a sea", Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said as the death toll from devasting floods in the country rose to 1,343. "We will need trillions of rupees to cope with this calamity," he added. As many as 33 million of Pakistan's 220 million population have been affected by the disaster blamed on climate change.

359.title: Volvo bus skids on slippery road amid rain in B'luru, video surfaces
359.article_body: A video of a Volvo bus skidding on Bengaluru-Mysuru expressway amid heavy rain has gone viral on the internet. The bus can be seen sliding haphazardly, before regaining control and speeding away as a truck lay on its side after having undergone an accident. As many as five people have died because of heavy rain in Karnataka since Sunday.

360.title: Impossible to isolate Russia, we will turn to Middle East: Putin
360.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin, while speaking at an economic forum in Vladivostok, said it would be "impossible" to isolate Russia. He said Russia sees more opportunities in entering markets in the Middle East after the West imposed sanctions in response to the invasion of Ukraine. "Moscow would defy the West's attempts to push Russia off the global stage," he added.

361.title: Anthony Joshua accepts Tyson Fury's 'battle of Britain' WBC title fight
361.article_body: Boxer Anthony Joshua has accepted Tyson Fury's challenge to fight in a "battle of Britain" match for the WBC heavyweight championship. Fury, who earlier said he had retired, said he's offering "belt-less" Joshua an opportunity to win the crown. Joshua, who suffered a second consecutive defeat to Ukrainian Oleksandr Usyk recently, responded by saying he will be "ready in December".

362.title: Will be easier to deal with big challenges if Rahul becomes Cong chief: Gehlot
362.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said there are big challenges before the country and if Rahul Gandhi becomes party chief, it will be easier to deal with them. "We'll all work together under Rahul Gandhi's leadership," Gehlot added. "There's so much polarisation, hate has been created in name of...religion. If this isn't controlled, it can go towards civil war," he added.

363.title: Man to cover 770 km on foot from Guj to Mumbai to see Lalbaugcha Raja
363.article_body: A 44-year-old education inspector is set to cover 770 km on foot from Gujarat's Junagadh district to Mumbai to see Lalbaugcha Raja, the idol of Lord Ganesha at Lalbaug. Samir Jagdishbhai Datani started his expedition on August 13 and reached Mira Road on Tuesday after walking for about 25 days. He is expected to reach his destination today (Wednesday).

364.title: Data-entry operator jumps off civic centre building in Delhi, dies
364.article_body: A man working as a data-entry operator with the Income Tax Department allegedly jumped to death from the Shyama Prasad Mukherjee Civic Centre building in New Delhi on Wednesday, police said. He jumped from the building's top floor, Indian Express reported quoting sources. DCP (Central district) Shweta Chauhan said the deceased has been identified and concerned authorities have been contacted.

365.title: 2 youths drown during Ganpati visarjan in Gadhi river in Panvel
365.article_body: Two youths reportedly drowned in Gadhi river in Panvel during Ganpati visarjan on Monday. Vikram Jamdar, 19, fell into the river after losing his balance while immersing Ganesh idol in the river. Following this, his 20-year-old cousin Shekhar jumped into the water to save him but was also swept away. The duo had gone to the river with 5-6 people.

366.title: Had India fielded first vs SL, things would've been different: Pujara
366.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara has said if India had won the toss and fielded first against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup Super 4 match, then the result would've been different. "I feel for the Indian team...I feel that the toss is playing a big factor in this Asia Cup," he stated. India lost the match by six wickets.

367.title: Haaland alone won't win us the Champions League: Man City manager
367.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said the team cannot solely rely on Erling Haaland to win them the Champions League. "All the players who come here were brought...to make us better. If we rely on Erling's shoulders, we will not win...Champions League," said Guardiola. Manchester City defeated Sevilla 4-0 in their opening Champions League match of the season on Tuesday.

368.title: NHAI to bear 80% land acquisition cost for Pune Ring Road
368.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has decided to bear 80% land acquisition cost for the proposed Pune Ring Road. The authority has appealed the Maharashtra government to bear the remaining cost. According to Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, the 170-km-long Pune Ring Road will help traffic coming from other cities to reach destination without passing through Pune city.

369.title: Ranbir, Alia not stopped at temple, they decided not to visit because of protest: Minister
369.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has said nobody stopped Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt at Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar temple. He said, "Like Ayan Mukerji paid his visit to the temple, Ranbir and Alia were also requested to visit but they decided not to go because of the protest. An artist should not use words which hurt the sentiments of people."

370.title: Whale vomit worth ₹10 crore seized, 4 men arrested in UP; pics released
370.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police Special Task Force (STF) arrested four members of a gang involved in smuggling of ambergris (whale vomit) in Lucknow. Police seized 4.12-kg whale vomit worth ₹10 crore in the operation. The sale of whale vomit, which is a sought-after ingredient for perfumes, is banned under Wildlife (Protection) Act of 1972.

371.title: Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan becomes world number one T20I batter, 3 Indians in top 20
371.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan has become the world number one T20I batter, displacing his compatriot Babar Azam from the top spot in the last rankings. Rizwan is only the third Pakistan batter to top the rankings for T20I batters after Babar and Misbah-ul-Haq. Suryakumar Yadav (fourth), Rohit Sharma (14th) and Ishan Kishan (19th) are the three Indians in top 20.

372.title: Probe ordered to check legality of 49 film studios in Mumbai
372.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) ordered an inquiry into the legality of 49 film studios located in Madh, Marve, Erangal, Bhati and Malad. BMC's order came after it received multiple complaints saying that the studios were illegally built in the No-Development Zone (NDZ) and Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ). Majority of the studios were built between 2021 and 2022.

373.title: Drinking water in B'luru to be restored on Wednesday: K'taka CM
373.article_body: Normal supply of drinking water in Bengaluru, which had been disrupted since Monday following heavy rainfall, will be restored on Wednesday, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai had announced. "Two pump houses had stopped functioning at TK Halli on Monday, affecting the water supply to Bengaluru," CM Bommai said, adding that the issue has been resolved now.

374.title: IIT Kanpur student found dead in hostel room
374.article_body: A PhD student of IIT Kanpur, Prasant Singh, was found dead inside his hostel room on Tuesday. The incident came to light when a hostel resident informed the security that Singh's room was locked from inside and there was no response to knocks. When the institute's administration forced the door open, he was found hanging from the ceiling.

375.title: Russia hasn't lost anything over its military campaign in Ukraine: Putin
375.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that Russia hasn't "lost anything" over its military campaign in Ukraine. "In terms of what we've gained, I can say that the main gain has been...strengthening of our sovereignty," he added. However, Putin admitted that Russia's decision to send troops into Ukraine had created a "certain polarisation, both in the world and within the country".

376.title: Nasdaq top exec to meet FM to discuss listing of Indian firms in US
376.article_body: Nasdaq Executive Vice-Chairman Edward Knight said that he will meet Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to discuss the listing of Indian companies in the US. "India should allow initial listing of companies on US stock exchanges," said Knight. He added that India has 260 unicorns ready to go public and that he would like to set up a startup-to-unicorn pipeline.

377.title: Video shows elderly woman selling snacks on Mumbai local; social media users offer help
377.article_body: A video showing an elderly woman selling snacks on a Mumbai local train has gone viral. Social media users praised the elderly woman and enquired for her contact details to extend help. The video was shared by Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal, who wrote, "This woman and thousands of people like her work hard to earn bread."

378.title: BESCOM received over 32,000 distress calls between Sept 4-5
378.article_body: More than 32,000 power outage complaints were received between Sunday and Monday (September 4-5) as there was an electricity shut down in several apartments and societies in Bengaluru due to heavy rainfall, the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) said. The power supply was suspended in these apartments and localities as a precautionary measure to avoid short-circuit incidents.

379.title: 'Brahmastra' sells over 1.30 lakh tickets despite boycott trend on Twitter
379.article_body: Amid the boycott trend on Twitter and protests against the film 'Brahmastra', the film managed to sell 1.31 lakh tickets at the national chains through advance booking for the opening day till September 7. As per Pinkvilla, the three national chains have sold over 2.50 lakh tickets for the movie for the opening weekend. 'Brahmastra' will feature Ranbir Kapoor.

380.title: Those who divided India now talking about 'Bharat jodo': BJP spokesperson
380.article_body: Commenting on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress has only done 'Bharat todo'. "Rahul Gandhi and First Family have always believed in undermining Sardar Patel and never celebrated his efforts…From 1947 to now…Those who divided India are now talking about 'Bharat jodo'," Poonawalla tweeted. "This is 'bhrashtachar jodo' not 'Bharat jodo'," he added.

381.title: India means opportunities, entire 21st century is India's: Goyal
381.article_body: Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said that India meant "opportunities" and it is not just this decade but the entire 21st century belongs to India. He was interacting with the faculty and students of the Stanford Graduate School of Business in San Francisco. Goyal is on a six-day visit to the US for various programmes.

382.title: French lawmakers visit Taiwan as tensions with China escalate
382.article_body: A delegation of five French lawmakers, led by Senator Cyril Pellevat, arrived in Taiwan on Wednesday. The lawmakers will meet high-ranking officials, including Taiwan's Vice President Lai Ching-te and Legislative Speaker You Si-Kun, to discuss security and innovation. This is first high-level European delegation to visit Taiwan since US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited despite China's warnings.

383.title: India's plan to shift to renewables has received a jolt: Sitharaman
383.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India's plans for transition to renewables have received a jolt. Addressing the US-India Business Council summit, Sitharaman said, "There are huge uncertainties over availability of crude, natural gas and coal due to the (Russia-Ukraine) war" because of which many nations, including India, are mulling going back to coal to meet their energy needs.

384.title: Dinesh Karthik can't finish games by sitting in the dressing room: Sehwag
384.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has questioned Deepak Hooda's inclusion in Team India's XI ahead of Dinesh Karthik in their Asia Cup Super 4 matches against Pakistan and Sri Lanka. "I can't understand the logic of Hooda's selection...Karthik can't finish games by sitting in the dressing room," stated Sehwag. Hooda didn't bowl in both the matches and scored 16 and 3.

385.title: Promoter says Bieber's India concert to go ahead as planned amid his break
385.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber announced he will be taking a break from performances across the world to put his health first. Earlier, Bieber had revealed he was suffering from Ramsay Hunt Syndrome. However, one of the promoters of Bieber's India concert stated the Asia leg of the Justice Tour, which includes his show in India in October, will continue as scheduled.

386.title: Suspect in Canada stabbing case had 59 criminal convictions: Documents
386.article_body: Myles Sanderson, an alleged attacker involved in killing 10 people in Canada, has 59 criminal convictions, parole documents said. Sanderson had been serving a sentence of four years and four months on charges including assault with a weapon. Public Safety Minister Marco Mendicino said that many of Sanderson’s past crimes happened when he was intoxicated.

387.title: Congress' politics confined to attacking PM, Centre: Maha minister
387.article_body: Maharashtra Revenue Minister Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil on Wednesday said Congress party's politics revolved around attacking the Centre while keeping larger party-related and public issues on the back-burner. "To retain its identity, it has to show it is doing something. So, the easiest thing to draw attention is to attack the Prime Minister Narendra Modi government," Patil added.

388.title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 2% amid reports of multiple block deals
388.article_body: Bharti Airtel shares opened 2% lower after reports of multiple block deals of 1.09% stake. Nearly 10.4 crore shares worth ₹7,906 crore changed hands at ₹750 apiece. Reuters had reported in August that Singapore Telecommunications would sell a 3.3% stake in Airtel to Bharti Telecom in the next three months. At 12 pm, Airtel was trading at ₹746.60 on BSE.

389.title: After Ranbir-Alia denied temple entry, MP posts celebs' pic with PM, says 'it won't help'
389.article_body: After Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt were reportedly stopped from entering into Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar temple by Bajrang Dal, Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi posted a photo of Bollywood celebrities with PM Narendra Modi. Chaturvedi wrote, "None of this photo op will help if you'll continue to be mute spectators to hate & believe it's not your business to talk politics."

390.title: Tejashwi Yadav makes surprise visit to govt hospitals in Patna, video surfaces
390.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday night made a surprise visit to Patna Medical College Hospital (PMCH), New Gardiner Road Hospital and Gardanibagh Hospital. "The condition of PMCH's Tata ward is getting worse," Tejashwi, who is also the state Health Minister, said. "There were no medicine arrangements...patients were not being provided facilities...negligence was seen," he stated.

391.title: Rajpath conveys you've come for 'Raj': Lekhi on renaming Rajpath to 'Kartavya Path'
391.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said that name of Rajpath has been changed to 'Kartavya Path' because Rajpath conveys you've come for 'Raj'. "We carried forward colonial mindset after Independence...PM said that country is celebrating 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' and we've to end imperialistic policies, symbols. So, the name of Rajpath has been changed," the BJP leader said.

392.title: US actress Megan Hilty's sister, brother-in-law and their kid die in seaplane crash
392.article_body: US actress Megan Hilty's sister Lauren Hilty, brother-in-law Ross Mickel, and their child Remy were among the 10 people who died in a seaplane crash in Mutiny Bay on Sunday. Lauren was pregnant with a baby boy, who was going to be named Luca, according to TMZ. It is currently unknown what caused the crash.

393.title: No sense to buy Twitter if we're heading into World War III: Musk's leaked text
393.article_body: Amid their lawsuit, Twitter's lawyer revealed a text sent by Tesla CEO Elon Musk to a banker, alleging that Musk was looking for a way out of the deal and that his claims on spam accounts were merely a pretext to end it. The message read, "It won't make sense to buy Twitter if we're heading into World War III."

394.title: Fire breaks out at showroom in Guwahati; cars, bikes worth ₹1.5 cr burnt
394.article_body: A fire broke out at a Benelli and Isuzu showroom in Assam's Guwahati. Isuzu cars worth at least ₹1.5 crore were burnt and Benelli bikes worth ₹6-7 lakh were burnt, a showroom employee said. "Totalling with the property loss, we hit a ₹4-5 crore loss," the employee added. As many as eight fire tenders were rushed to the site.

395.title: Govt staff to get salary today, no lack of funds: Punjab minister
395.article_body: Asserting that there is no shortage of funds, Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema on Wednesday said that state government's employees will get their salaries by evening. "[The] Punjab government made 9,000 contractual employees permanent, due to which the process of giving out salaries…got delayed by three-four days," said Cheema. He added that 18,000 new recruitments have been done.

396.title: He's boyish, immature: Jairam over Assam CM's remark on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
396.article_body: Following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's "Congress should start 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Pakistan" remark, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said, "He's a recent migrant to BJP, so he has to make outrageous statements every day." He added, "I don't take Assam CM seriously...I think Assam CM is boyish, immature...makes statements only to prove his loyalty to his new masters."

397.title: Pune's Yerawada, Kothrud reported highest noise level this Ganeshotsav: MPCB
397.article_body: Pune's Yerawada and Kothrud reported highest noise levels in the city during Ganesh festival this year, according to Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB). As per MPCB data, Yerawada recorded the highest average noise level at 84.69 decibels, followed by Kothrud and Shaniwar Peth at 84.68 and 83.67 decibels, respectively. This year, noise pollution was monitored at 18 locations across Pune.

398.title: Didn't know much about Vicky, was won over when I met him: Katrina
398.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', said that her relationship with Vicky Kaushal was "unexpected and out of the blue". "I didn't even know much about Vicky. He was just a name I had heard...But when I met him, I was won over," she added. Vicky and Katrina tied the knot in December 2021.

399.title: I attempted to make 'Ponniyin...' but Mani Ratnam succeeded: Kamal Haasan
399.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan has revealed MGR had given him the rights to make 'Ponniyin Selvan'. "I knew that either Mani Ratnam or I would make 'Ponniyin Selvan'. I attempted but Mani succeeded," Kamal added. Speaking about the time he wanted to make the film, Kamal stated Sivaji felt Rajinikanth would be perfect for 'Vandhiyathevan', whereas, he would play Aditya Karikalan.

400.title: Where is India broken?: BJP leader on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
400.article_body: Former UP Cabinet Minister Sidharth Nath Singh criticised Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said that he has a problem with the terminology of Congress. "Where is India broken, which Congress have come out to connect? India is not disintegrated...then how can you say so?" he added. "You had divided India on the basis of your issues," the BJP leader said.

401.title: Nothing can be better than this feeling: Anil on becoming grandparent
401.article_body: Speaking about becoming a grandparent, actor Anil Kapoor has said that he is always there by his newborn grandchild's side. Last month, Anil's daughter and actress Sonam Kapoor welcomed a baby boy. "Nothing can be better than this feeling. I would like to say my dialogue (from 'Dil Dhadakne Do'), 'I feel on top of the world'," he added.
